author: Margi Murphy
description: Israeli security officials are investigating how the high-profile phone contacts, photos and messages belonging to former Prime Minister Naftali Bennett leaked online.
title: Former Israeli Prime Minister Phone Contacts, Chats Leak Online

description: US Representative Mike Lawler, a Republican from New York, explains why he backed a Democratic effort to force a vote on extending Affordable Care Act subsidies on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Why Rep. Lawler Broke With Speaker Johnson Over ACA

author: Alicia Diaz
description: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer indicated that he supports keeping the US in the trade accord with Canada and Mexico, acknowledging in closed-door briefings with lawmakers that issues with both nations remain.
title: Trump Official Signals Support for Trade Deal With Canada, Mexico

description: Trump’s chief of staff Susie Wiles objected to an unflattering Vanity Fair profile. It’s her own fault, Nia-Malika Henderson says. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Susie Wiles Suddenly Seems Dispensable

author: Jessica Nix
description: The US Department of Health and Human Services has terminated millions of dollars in grants for the American Academy of Pediatrics, including research into reducing sudden infant death syndrome and the early identification of autism.
title: RFK Jr. Slashes Funding for the American Academy of Pediatrics

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The US is seeking to significantly expand its vetting of social media accounts for people who want to enter the country. In 2019, during President Donald Trump’s first term, the US imposed a requirement that visa applicants disclose their social media accounts. The Department of Homeland Security now aims to apply a similar requirement to another group: travelers from countries such as the UK, Japan and Australia whose citizens can enter the US without a visa.
title: How New Social Media Checks Would Change Travel to US

author: Myles Miller
description: FBI Deputy Director Dan Bongino, a right-wing podcaster who ascended to the upper levels of the nation’s preeminent law enforcement agency, is expected to soon leave his job, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: FBI Deputy Director Bongino Expected to Depart After Rocky Tenure

author: Bob Van Voris
description: Ghislaine Maxwell asked a judge to throw out her sex-trafficking conviction and 20-year prison sentence on the eve of a deadline for the Justice Department to turn over a trove of documents relating to her ex-boyfriend, the disgraced financier, Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Maxwell Seeks to Reverse Conviction as Epstein Deadline Looms

author: Mario Parker
description: The president is set to deliver a prime-time televised address tonight.
title: Trump Gets Another Try to Deliver His Economic Message

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss Fed Governor Chris Waller's latest comments, including his thoughts that the FOMC shouldn't be in a rush to cut, but rates could be lower. Deutsche Bank Chief US Economist Matthew Luzzetti joins the show to discuss. Also, UBS Alignment Partners Wealth Management MD Alli McCartney on what's ahead for the Fed as AI worries and eco data weigh on market sentiment. Plus, Partnership for New York City CEO Kathryn Wylde discusses her role on NYC mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani's transition team. Also, PwC US IPO Leader Mike Bellin breaks down today's Medline debut, setting the stage for a massive 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed's Waller Backs More Rate Cuts, Medline's Debut | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/17/2025

description: President Donald Trump is likely to announce who will be the next chair of the Federal Reserve sometime in early January, with National Economic Director Kevin Hassett and former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh seen as frontrunners. Deutsche Bank Chief US Economist Matthew Luzzetti believes  that whoever is the pick will have to "earn the market's trust" and bring inflation back down to target. He joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the next era of the Federal Reserve and the state of the US labor market. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Next Fed Chair Needs to 'Earn the Market's Trust,' Says Deutsche's Luzzetti

author: Naureen S Malik
description: Households and businesses spanning New Jersey to Chicago are poised to pay record sums for electricity as an AI-fueled demand surge drives up power costs on the largest US grid.
title: Costs on Key US Grid Hit New Record, Testing Affordability

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan is widely expected to raise its benchmark rate Friday to the highest level in three decades, in a sign of growing confidence that it will achieve its stable inflation target.
title: BOJ Is Expected to Raise Rate to Highest in 30 Years

author: Faris Mokhtar
description: Barely seven months after Lawrence Wong led the People’s Action Party to victory in his first election as prime minister, the government is onto its next strategic task: renewing its talent pipeline to preserve the long-term stability it’s become known for.
title: Singapore Ruling Party Hunts for Future Leaders to Protect Power

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondents Joe Mathieu discusses the latest from DC. On today's show, Democratic Congressman Suhas Subramanyam of Virginia, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Bellwether Government Affairs CEO Arshi Siddiqui and former Republican Congressman Patrick McHenry. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: GOP Moderates Force ACA Credit Vote | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/17/2025

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump paid tribute to two US soldiers and an interpreter killed in an ambush in Syria as their remains were returned Wednesday to Delaware’s Dover Air Force Base.
title: Trump Witnesses Dignified Transfer of US Troops Killed in Syria

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Israel gave the green light to a deal worth 112 billion shekels ($35 billion) to supply natural gas to Egypt from 2026 to 2040, overcoming some pushback on the agreement’s terms.
title: Israel Approves $35 Billion Deal to Export Natural Gas to Egypt

author: Sana Pashankar
description: US lawmakers confirmed fintech billionaire and SpaceX astronaut Jared Isaacman to run NASA on Wednesday, ending a prolonged and whipsawing nomination process that had left the space agency without a permanent administrator for most of the year.
title: Isaacman Wins Senate Vote to Become Trump’s NASA Chief

description: US IPO volume is poised to exceed $40 billion this year, with Medline Inc.'s IPO shares surging 30% in their trading debut after the medical supplier raised $6.26 billion in the year’s biggest initial public offering Wednesday. As the calendar flips to 2026, there’s also hope that some of the world’s biggest private tech companies, such as SpaceX, might also go public. PwC US IPO Leader Mike Bellin joined Carol Massar, Tim Stenovec, and Natalia Kniazhevich on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Deep Pipeline of Quality IPOs for 2026, Says PwC's Bellin

author: Bill Allison
description: The dark-money arm of Donald Trump’s sprawling political operation entered 2025 with $84 million in the bank, highlighting the president’s fundraising prowess and offering insight into his war chest ahead of crucial midterm elections.
title: Trump’s Dark Money Group Started 2025 With $84 Million War Chest

description:
Former Republican Representative Patrick McHenry, who served as chair of the House Financial Services Committee, and is a Bloomberg Contributor says Republicans have failed to create a successful message to counter the Democrats' strength on the Affordable Care Act. 

Four Republican lawmakers have signed onto House Democrats’ effort to force a vote on a three-year clean extension of Affordable Care Act subsidies, an act of defiance against GOP leaders as moderates grow frustrated over health care.
Three Pennsylvania Republicans — Reps. Brian Fitzpatrick, Rob Bresnahan, and Ryan Mackenzie, along with New York’s Mike Lawler, signed Democrats’ discharge petition on the three-year bill. Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries (N.Y.) is helming the effort.
Congress has been scrambling to address a coming health insurance cliff as Covid-era enhanced subsidies expire Dec. 31.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: GOP Lacks Sufficient Plan on Healthcare, Says McHenry

description:
Rep. Suhas Subramanyam (D-VA) tells Balance of Power he expects Congress to be able to vote on an extension of Obamacare subsidies "at some point." 

Moderate House Republicans have revolted against Speaker Mike Johnson and joined with Democrats to force a vote in January on expiring Obamacare subsidies.
The rebellion comes after Johnson blocked swing-district Republicans from having a floor vote this week on their plan to tie a one or two-year extension of the subsidies to cost saving changes to the program.
“We’ve exhausted nearly every option,” New York Republican Mike Lawler said. “And, you know, we worked in good faith over these past many weeks to come to a compromise bill.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Moderate Republican Revolt to Force Jan. Obamacare Vote

description: Partnership for New York City President and CEO Kathryn Wylde joined ‘Bloomberg Businessweek Daily’ to discuss her role on Zohran Mamdani’s transition team, his proposed policies, and the willingness of business leaders to work with the mayor-elect. She speaks with Myles Miller, Carol Massar, and Tim Stenovec.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Kathy Wylde on Role in Mamdani Transition Team

author: Zach Williams
description: The Senate Wednesday approved a defense authorization bill with an aviation provision critics say would endanger public safety nearly one year after a mid-air collision near Washington, DC.
title: Senate Passes Aviation Provision, Then Moves to Revise It

author: Jim Wyss
description: The leaders of two small Caribbean countries say they were blindsided by a White House decision to issue travel restrictions over their so-called “golden passport” programs — even as the US works to create its own pay-for-residency initiative.
title: Trump Travel Ban Over ‘Golden Passports’ Adds to Caribbean Woes

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: The GOP-led Congress is letting Affordable Care Act subsidies lapse, triggering a cost spike. But rising auto insurance bills are taking a toll on Americans, too.
title: The Other Insurance Cost Fueling the US Affordability Crisis

author: Jeannette Neumann
description: Bloomingdale’s terminated the employee who inserted a slip of paper with the phrase “Free Palestine” into a package that had Hanukkah-themed pajamas, according to a person close to the company.
title: Bloomingdale’s Fires Worker Over 'Free Palestine' Note in Hanukkah PJs

author: Aashna Shah
description: Maryland officials anticipate issuing bonds to help finance the rebuilding of the Francis Scott Key Bridge, which collapsed in 2024 and disrupted a major economic gateway.
title: Maryland Official Says Bonds Likely for Key Bridge Rebuild

author: Miranda Davis, Isis Almeida, Shruti Singh
description: President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown is returning to Chicago, with raids carried out by US Border Patrol threatening to disrupt businesses before the holidays.
title: Border Patrol Returns to Haunt Chicago’s Economy Before Holidays

author: Maya Averbuch
description: The US Treasury added Mexico’s Santa Rosa de Lima Cartel to its sanctions list, blaming the criminal group for fuel theft that undercuts global energy markets.
title: US Treasury Imposes Sanctions on Mexican Cartel Accused of Fuel Theft

author: Michael Nienaber, Daniel Basteiro
description: Germany, France and Spain promised a decision on a troubled European fighter jet program by year’s end — but with just days left to hit that deadline, leaders might not discuss it on the sidelines of a summit this week, people familiar with the matter say.
title: As Clock Runs Down, FCAS Nations Consider Separate Next-Gen Jets

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal appeals court will allow President Donald Trump to keep National Guard troops in Washington in the coming months, finding the administration had shown that it has a strong chance of winning a legal fight over the deployment.
title: Trump’s DC Troop Deployment Allowed for Now by Appeals Court

description: Handout footage from Frankenburg Technologies shows interceptor missile strike drone in live-fire field test in Latvia on December 12.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Video Shows Interceptor Missile Hitting Drone in Live-Fire Test in Latvia

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is expected to appoint a veteran diplomat as his new ambassador to Washington after opting against a candidate with a business background.
title: UK’s US Envoy Set to Be Career Diplomat After Chandra Exits Race

author: Andrea Palasciano, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union wants to impose strict “Buy European” rules on Ukraine’s potential loan backed by Russian assets, which leaders will try to finalize during a summit on Thursday.
title: EU Seeks ‘Buy European’ Rules for Russian Asset Loan to Ukraine

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio will donate $250 each to 300,000 Trump accounts for children in Connecticut, the hedge fund investor said Wednesday.
title: Ray Dalio to Donate to Trump Accounts in Connecticut

author: Sergio Mendoza, Eric Martin, Jorgelina Do Rosario
description: Bolivia’s new foreign minister said Venezuela’s crisis can only be resolved through a democratic transition anchored in institutions strong enough to survive “the day after” President Nicolas Maduro potentially leaves power.
title: Bolivia Urges Strategy for Venezuela’s ‘Day After Maduro’

author: Alex Vasquez, Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexico offered to mediate between the US and Venezuela as President Donald Trump’s tanker blockade increases tension between the two nations.
title: Mexico Offers to Mediate to Prevent a US-Venezuela Conflict

author: Lucy White
description: The UK could miss out on hundreds of millions of pounds of tax revenues a year if it raises the salary levels required of migrant workers coming to the country, according to a review by the government’s immigration advisers.
title: Lifting Required UK Migrant Pay Would Lower Treasury Tax Take

author: Erik Wasson, Maeve Sheehey, Erin Durkin
description: Moderate House Republicans have revolted against Speaker Mike Johnson and joined with Democrats to force a vote in January on expiring Obamacare subsidies.
title: Moderate Republican Revolt to Force January Obamacare Vote

author: Onur Ant
description: Turkey is seeking to return S-400 air defense systems it bought from Russia nearly a decade ago, a move that would end a controversial deal that roiled its relationship with the US and other NATO members.
title: Erdogan Asks Putin to Take Back Missiles to Win US Favor

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will attend a European Union leaders’ summit on Thursday in Brussels, as he tries to secure support for a loan backed by Russian assets.
title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy to Attend EU Leaders Summit Thursday

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland approved energy tariffs for next year, setting the key parameter for the power industry’s profitability, in a move that is poised to slightly increase electricity bills.
title: Polish Power Bills to Rise Slightly as Regulator Sets New Tariff

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is threatening to oppose a pair of key European Union initiatives, adding to questions that the bloc can act decisively on complex issues.
title: Meloni Signals Opposition to Mercosur, Ukraine Asset Deals

author: Zosia Wanat
description: Poland will spend much of the funds from the European Union’s military loan program on its own rearmament rather than common purchases with allies, as Warsaw bolsters its defenses to deter Russian aggression.
title: Poland to Prioritize EU-Wide Defense Fund for National Defense

author: Ari Natter
description: The US government has ordered a Washington State coal plant to continue operating past its scheduled retirement date, marking the third time the Trump administration has invoked emergency authorities to keep a power plant running.
title: US Orders Washington Coal Plant to Remain Open, Citing Emergency

author: Felix Tam, Foster Wong
description: Hong Kong canceled its annual fireworks show over Victoria Harbor, a decision that comes some three weeks after a deadly blaze in a high-rise estate.
title: Hong Kong Cancels Fireworks Over Harbor After Deadly Blaze

author: Alex Wickham, Will Standring
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer cleared the way for the transfer of £2.5 billion ($3.3 billion) of proceeds from the sale of Chelsea Football Club to Ukraine, moving closer to ending the three-year deadlock over the fate of the frozen funds.
title: UK Issues License to Hand £2.5 Billion Chelsea Sale Funds to Ukraine

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Nobel Laureate María Corina Machado has left Norway, Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store told Bloomberg Wednesday.
title: Venezuelan Nobel Winner Machado Has Left Norway, Premier Says

author: Ari Natter
description: The US is on pace to pump more oil this year than any other nation in history as President Donald Trump puts the federal government’s full weight behind his sweeping agenda to champion fossil fuels and gut support for wind and solar.
title: Trump US Vowed Energy Dominance. Here’s How He’s Doing

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said her government is not ready to sign a massive trade agreement with South American countries this week, publicly joining France’s opposition and casting doubt on the pact’s future.
title: Italy Seeks Delay to EU-Mercosur Free-Trade Agreement

author: Eleanor Thornber
description: The European Commission proposed new measures to cut costs and simplify food and feed safety rules in the bloc, including making it easier for pesticide to get approved.
title: EU Targets €1 Billion Saving With New Food, Feed Safety Package

author: Netty Idayu Ismail
description: Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said he’s been in contact with the leaders of Thailand and Cambodia, both of whom have said they want to resolve their border clashes as soon as possible.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar Says Thailand, Cambodia Keen to End Conflict

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel’s intelligence chief accused Iran of still seeking to develop nuclear weapons and use them against the Jewish state, views that appear to raise the prospect of further conflict between the two countries.
title: Mossad Chief Says Iran Still Aspires to Build Nuclear Weapons

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: US president ordered a blockade of sanctioned tankers going in and out of the country.
title: Trump Turns Up the Heat on Venezuela’s Maduro

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany’s cabinet approved plans for a state-subsidized retirement savings account for youngsters, part of a broader push by Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s coalition to shore up a pension system under growing strain.
title: Germany Launches Child Pension Accounts as Aging Strains System

author: Will Standring
description: The UK’s largest trade union has elected a vocal critic of Keir Starmer as leader in a result that stores up trouble for the prime minister’s grip over his party.
title: Starmer Critic Wins Key UK Union Post in Headache for Labour

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers will hold a closed-door meeting on Wednesday to approve a record number of arms contracts, kicking off a defense splurge of more than €50 billion ($59 billion) in a single session.
title: Germany Set to Approve More Than €50 Billion in Military Orders

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukrainian drones attacked Lukoil PJSC’s Grayfer field in the Caspian Sea, damaging an offshore gas platform, according to Ukraine’s General Staff.
title: Ukraine Says It Hit Another Lukoil Field in Caspian Sea

author: Oliver Crook, Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo President Vjosa Osmani praised her US counterpart Donald Trump for supporting peace in the Western Balkans and wider region of Europe.
title: Kosovo President Praises Trump’s Contribution to Peace in Region

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz said that German troops could participate in a coalition to secure a demilitarized zone in Ukraine after a possible peace agreement under rules that would permit them to “retaliate against corresponding Russian incursions and attacks.”
title: Merz Says German Troops Could Counter Russian Attacks in Ukraine

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Grace Sihombing
description: Two of Southeast Asia’s largest economies head into 2026 tilting toward looser monetary policy as they face economic risks from political turmoil at home, investor wariness abroad and Donald Trump’s tariffs at the border.
title: Thailand and Indonesia Eye Looser Monetary Policy Into Rocky 2026

author: Will Standring
description: British students will be able to study at European universities as part of the Erasmus exchange program as the UK’s rapprochement with the European Union gathers pace under Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s Labour government.
title: UK Rejoins EU Student Program as Starmer Pursues Warmer Ties

author: Eric Martin, Kate Sullivan, Alberto Nardelli, Natalia Drozdiak
description: The US is preparing a fresh round of sanctions on Russia’s energy sector to increase the pressure on Moscow should President Vladimir Putin reject a peace agreement with Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Readies New Russia Sanctions If Putin Rejects Peace Deal

author: Cory Bennett
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen issued her clearest rebuke yet to Donald Trump’s attacks on Europe, imploring the continent to chart its own course in a changed world.
title: EU Blasts Trump’s Attacks as ‘Outdated’ and Urges Independence

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. 

On today's show, US President Donald Trump is ordering a "complete blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers moving in and out of Venezuela. The move increases pressure on Caracas, amid a US military buildup in the region.

Warner Brothers is understood to be planning to reject Paramount's hostile takeover bid, as a major backer walks away from the deal. Affinity Partners, Jared Kushner's private equity firm, is exiting from the takeover battle.

The Trump Administration is threatening to retaliate against the EU over efforts to tax American tech companies.

The department singled out prominent European companies including Accenture, Siemens and Spotify as possible targets.

Today's guests: Eurostack Founder & Chair Cristina Caffarra & Shopify EMEA Managing Director Deann Evans (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Blocks Venezuela Oil Tankers, Warner to Reject Paramount Bid | Daybreak Europe 12/17/2025

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: South African authorities arrested seven people suspected of illegally processing applications for refugee status in the US, as part of the American effort to bring in White people from the country.
title: South Africa Arrests Seven People Over US Refugee Applications

author: Kanoko Matsuyama
description: Chinese visitor growth to Japan slowed in November to its weakest pace in nearly four years, as Beijing curbed travel amid rising tensions over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s remarks on Taiwan.
title: Chinese Tourist Arrivals to Japan Slow as Tensions Simmer

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: The Bank of Thailand cut its key interest rate to the lowest since 2022 to bolster a fragile economy weighed down by a stubbornly strong currency and renewed political uncertainty.
title: Thailand Cuts Rates to Three-Year Low as Baht Weighs on Growth

description: President Donald Trump said he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers going into and leaving Venezuela, ratcheting up pressure on Caracas amid a US military buildup in the region and the threat of land strikes. Bloomberg's Stephen Stapczynski reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Ratchets Up Pressure on Venezuela With Oil Blockade

author: Colum Murphy, Nectar Gan
description: China’s depiction of Jimmy Lai as a “traitor” in the aftermath of his conviction on national security charges suggests efforts to seek clemency for the 78-year-old former media mogul, even if by US President Donald Trump, will face challenging odds.
title: China’s Hard Line on Jimmy Lai Undercuts Trump’s Release Calls

author: Gresa Kraja, Andrea Dudik
description: His firm pulled out of a planned luxury hotel in Serbia after anti-government protests, while a resort in Albania is being overshadowed by local scandals.
title: Jared Kushner’s Luxury Dreams Collide With Balkan Politics

author: Hallie Gu
description: China is selling large volumes of soybeans from its state reserves, as it steps up purchases from the US to fulfill an apparent agreement between the two countries in late October.
title: China Stepping Up Soy Auctions as It Buys More Beans From US

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: The head of Japan’s auto workers union said he’s concerned that if the central raises its benchmark interest rate Friday — as is widely expected — the move could weigh on companies’ ability to raise wages in the coming fiscal year.
title: Japan’s Auto Union Chair Fears BOJ Hike May Impede Wage Growth

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The proposed White House ballroom will cost as much as $400 million, with President Donald Trump saying it will also be equipped to host inaugurations going forward.
title: Trump Says Cost of New Ballroom May Now Reach $400 Million

author: Annie Lee, Alfred Cang
description: A Chinese court has convicted 27 people for smuggling antimony ingots out of the country without export permits, in a symbolic case highlighting Beijing’s determination to tighten its grip on strategic minerals.
title: Chinese Court Convicts 27 for Smuggling Critical Metal Antimony

author: Josh Xiao
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has expressed full support for Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee, praising his administration’s performance after a year defined by a deadly fire, a financial turnaround and the conviction of the city’s top national security target.
title: Xi Backs Hong Kong Leader After Deadly Fire, Jimmy Lai Verdict

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea may need to pursue a separate bilateral accord with the US to secure the right to build nuclear-powered submarines, the country’s national security adviser said as he prepares to meet with senior officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington.
title: South Korea Eyes Standalone US Deal to Build Nuclear Submarines

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The head of the US Federal Aviation Administration told a top US Senate Democrat that he still holds stock in Republic Airways Holdings Inc., the airline he ran before joining President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Top US Aviation Regulator Confirms He Still Owns Airline Stock

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Ty Cobb, Former Federal Prosecutor and Special Counsel to President Donald Trump during his first term, talks about the current White House Chief of Staff, Susie Wiles, and her recent interview with Vanity Fair, and Representative Katherine Clark (D-MA) discusses the Affordable Care Act subsidies deadline and the White House Briefing to Congressional Leaders on the strikes against Venezuelan boats in September. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump, White House Staff Defends Wiles After Vanity Fair Interview | Balance of Power: 12/16/2025

author: Carolina Pulice
description: Brazil’s government will ask power regulator Aneel to initiate the termination process for an Enel concession in São Paulo, Mining and Energy Minister Alexandre Silveira announced, following prolonged power outages in the country’s wealthiest city and nearby municipalities.
title: Brazil to Seek End of Enel’s São Paulo Concession After Outages

description: Ty Cobb, Former Federal Prosecutor and Special Counsel to President Donald Trump during his first term, talks about the current White House Chief of Staff, Susie Wiles, and her recent interview with Vanity Fair, saying her remarks were 'almost candid about how weird things are in the administration.' He speaks with Joe Mathieu on 'Balance of Power.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: There Was a Real Chief of Staff: Cobb on Wiles Interview

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s exports rose by the most since February as demand jumped in the US and EU, offsetting a drop in shipments to China.
title: Japan’s Exports Increase Led by Jump in Demand in US, EU
